timeline.author: karussell

timeline.bodyText:
This is now a bit too ugly as without indent and looks like it should be debugging info IMO:
2020-02-14 19:47:56.845 [main] INFO  c.g... properties:
graph.dataaccess: RAM_STORE
ch.enabled: false
graph.flag_encoders: car
prepare.ch.weightings: fastest
prepare.min_one_way_network_size: 0
graph.location: graph-cache
prepare.min_network_size: 0
routing.ch.disabling_allowed: true
routing.max_visited_nodes: 1500000
prepare.lm.weightings: fastest
routing.round_trip.max_retries: 2
timeline.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: Yes toString is meant for debugging or what do you mean? The output should be indented another way so it resembles the yaml file?
replies.author: easbar
karussell

replies.bodyText: We can adjust toString() to whatever you/we think is useful. What do you not like about the current format? Do you think its too verbose (because of the new lines), or would you prefer key=value over key: value? Note that as soon as we add profiles to the config (or other typed parameters asPMap().toString() will no longer contain the whole information.
replies.author: easbar

replies.bodyText:
Yes, the new line is good for debugging but a bit too much for normal startup info.

Note that as soon as we add profiles to the config (or other typed parameters asPMap().toString() will no longer contain the whole information.

Yes, for now I just need to make sure certain info is correctly picked up
replies.author: karussell

replies.bodyText: Ah is it? I thought this is something quite useful at startup. But yeah feel free to change it to whatever you prefer, I do not care that much.
replies.author: easbar
